name: Resident Evil™ 5/ Biohazard 5®
description: This game is a port of the Games for Windows - Live version that was released in 2009. If you buy the Untold Stories Bundle here on Steam, it will be the same as upgrading to Resident Evil 5 Gold Edition.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows 7                                  Processor: Intel Core™ 2 Quad 2.4GHz or better, AMD Phenom™ II x4 3.4GHZ or better                                  Memory: 4GB or better           Graphics: 512 MB VRAM, NVIDIA® GeForce 9800 series or better, ATI Radeon HD 7770 or better         Display:  Minimum 800 x 600 pixel resolution         Sound: DirectSound Compatible (DirectX 9.0c or higher)              DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c / Shader 3.0  or better                            Hard Drive: 15 GB free hard drive space                  Peripherals: Keyboard and mouse                Internet connection required for game activation.
recommended_requirements: Supported OS: Windows 7                                  Processor: Intel Core™ i5-3570 or better, AMD Phenom™ II x4 3.4GHZ or better                                  Memory: 4GB or better           Graphics: 512 MB VRAM, NVIDIA(R) GeForce® GTX 650 or better, ATI Radeon HD 7770 or better         Display:  Minimum 1280 x 720 pixel resolution         Sound: DirectSound Compatible (DirectX 9.0c or higher)              DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c / Shader 3.0 or better                             Hard Drive: 15 GB free hard drive space                  Peripherals: Keyboard and mouse, controller supported                 Internet connection required for game activation.

reviews.review_text: Chris Redfield's arms are bigger than my future.

Me and my boyfriend played Resident Evil 5 coop where the first player controls Chris and the second player controls Sheva. We had many fun moments but also many frustrating moments. I was very unsure if I should recommend it to you or not.  Let's start with the positive things. It's a really good coop action game, one of those where you have to stay together and really cooperate. The game has many environments, cool combat music and great variety of bosses! You and your partner can tease each other with your character's voice commands. We were shouting at each other a lot and it was very entertaining.  In my short clips video you can see all the good things I was writting about. We were really having fun and laughing a lot:   Fun Times in RE5 - Clips    And here comes all the criticism I need to share with you. The Steam PC version of Resident Evil 5 has many bugs and complicated mouse+keyboard controls. I don't like quick time events very much. But the weird combinations of buttons in RE5 are unbelievable. Sometimes A+D and sometimes F+V with very short time to react to that. I watched some gameplay on consoles and they only had to press one button on their controllers. It's even more annoying during cutscenes when you sit back, enjoy and don't expect anything.  Another unpleasant moment is when you find out that you as Sheva won't get the steam achivement for finishing a chapter if your partner's game crashes or if you decide to stop playing in the middle of a chapter, save the progress and finish later. Only Chris, the player who host the game, will get it then.  It happened to us that an important enemy with a keycard we needed spawned in an inaccessible area, I was locked in a cage and my boyfriend spent quite long time trying to get there while I was waiting and waiting for ages. We tried it again and this time we only saw his shadow on the floor. I tried to use explosives so we got him down from that unknown place this time and luckily it was on the right side.  Another very annoying moment was the final boss fight where you have to press F as Sheva for almost a minute. Not just that but you have to do it SUPER fast. You kind of need to be like The Flash! I played this game 6 years ago as well and I remember I had to give up back then. It was not possible. On my last playthrough I tried it so many times and I managed to do it only once.. My finger really hurt, so I had to ignore the pain and was lucky my boyfriend didn't mess it up after that so we could continue. Uffff! These moments definitely made us want to ragequit..  RE5 Bosses in general can be very annoying. When you are not doing the right thing - shooting the right spots at the right moments , you are basically wasting your ammo and the game won't give you any more and it won't make you fail either even when you clearly can't do it. You just have to decide for yourself to restart from the last checkpoint.. But in case you somehow manage to do it but you already wasted all your ammo before, good luck to you, because you can't buy ammo directly. However you can buy weapons and sell them so you keep the ammo they had.  Final verdict: Partly recommended! Overall I am very hesitant in case of Resident Evil 5. I am a fan of RE games. I like the coop option of it. But all the bugs are breaking the full enjoyment of it for me. I believe the console version is much better! If you love Resident Evil games and you have the patience to deal with it, go for it! Wait for a sale, please. Don't pay the full price for something what couldn't have bugs fixed since 2009.  Thank you for reading my review! In case you have some questions feel welcome to ask me :)
10/10 Jills boobs bounce everytime I aim.

still one of my favorite games to play because of the good coop mechanics Now finaly with the DLC  but a bad port of the former flawless GfWl version. region lock, messed up enemy pathfinding and disconnects just to name a few errors that will never get fixed...  it's still good and fun game to play with friends, but it could have been a LOT better. Make sure to install ' Maluc's patch 1 bug fixes '.
Awesome game!!! Really nice game. Even the single player without coop is enjoyable. Really worth.
A great game and a very well-optimized port, even though the controls can be a little wierd when playing with keyboard and mouse. The single-player and co-op intertwine really well. Play it!

Resident Evil 5 may not as scary.. and compared to its predecessors is more action oriented. But oh boy.. This one is one of the best RE I've ever played. - Chapters + rating = high replay value - Competent port - So many unlockables and collectibles - New partner system gives new dynamic on gameplay   Conclusion : A masterpiece that needs to be played by everyone

Resident Evil 5 is one of my favorite Resident Evil Games. I really enjoyed Resident Evil 4, but it got boring after a while. However, Resident Evil 5 is very addictive and very fun to play. I can't get bored of it! On my crappy laptop it plays, surprisingly, very well! It may not be perfect 60 fps but it does sometimes exceed 30. Graphics are beautiful, and my brother's PC runs at over an average of 150 FPS. I, for one, am not knit picky about graphics or single frames, and I very much enjoyed how the game looks on my laptop. I saw the true quality while observing my brother's computer, as we played CO-OP Story Mode, beating Normal, and just finishing up Veteran, and soon Professional, and the graphics are unbelievebly astonishing! Great work, CapCom! I've been playing this game and beat it on different consoles such as the PS (or perhaps XBOX) for a couple years now and this game never gets boring for me! Thanks so much for an awesome game! ~3~
Game was finished 19 times on profi, without cheats and the infinite ammo , now I can sleep quietly.

I spent countless hours on RE5 on xbox 360. The PC version has great graphics and still delivers dynamic game play, however it does lack local co-op :(. All in all, definitely worth a purchase on sale.  RE5 takes place in Africa with Chris and Sheva, agents of the BSAA group which contains bio-virus weapons. You are basically fighting zombies with some cognition about what's going on, they aren't blindly stupid walking around like most zombie games. Rather, these 'infected' come at you from all sorts of angles and drop down from all sorts of heights to greet you with a chainsaw, machete, crossbow or just a good old fashioned hammer. Characters vary from simple opponents which can be taken down with a few shots, to heavier opponents that may charge or swing obscenely heavy weapons at you.   What makes this game so good though? At first, I hated the game layout as it was tough to access my equipment menu or to pull out my gun. I should say that you CANNOT fire from the hip. You have to aim down your sights first in order to get a shot off. These two reasons sort of put me off but as I got deeper into the story, I got pulled in and liked how they intermingled melee with the ability to shoot opponents. You CANNOT simply press a button and start hitting someone. Just like pressing two buttons to get a shot off, you need to hold LB (to pull your machete out) then hit RT to get a hit off. This is one melee mode, the other involves 'stunning' the opponents (boss's and regular opponents are susceptible to this) and then running up to them and pressing X which usually knocks them on their bum. Additionally, when the opponents are on the ground the player has a moment to curb stomp them (as seen in Gears of War). This melee mode is very particular, just as the entire game is made this way. You do not feel in complete control of the game until you've familiarized yourself with the game mechanics. Either you'll hate what Capcom did or you'll like it, simple as that. When you recognize when an opponent is stunned it makes a world of difference. I should also add when your partner is being held down by a zombie, the other partner can run up and press B to free the partner. I'm going to say it again even though I already said it, you'll either get along with this sort of game mechanic or you'll find it annoying you can't simply fire from the hip or melee at will. The movement controls over all feel smooth while the camera cannot be moved from an over the shoulder position. I have to give them credit for trying to include a wide variety of weapons from rifles, shotguns, automatics and pistols. On top of that, incendiary grenades, regular grenades are also included with a compliment of herbs that you can mix to heal yourself (or your partner on the fly). There is a slight RPG element to the game where you can upgrade weapons for better impact and a quicker reloading scheme. I would highly suggest spending your money wisely and choosing a weapon you know you'll be using a lot.   The graphics as I've mentioned are a lot better than xbox 360's version, everything feels smooth and the cinematics are pretty tight. The sounds are decent and do not really sound different from shot to shot, or when you break a barrel. The opponents also sound generically the same (unless you're facing a unique boss).   Overall, if this version had local co-op it would get a higher rating. Since it's a PC version and apparently we don't play local, it's going to hurt it's score a bit. None the less, a great game and would highly recommend it on sale.  RATING : 7.8/10        Gameplay   B     Story / Campaign   B     Visuals / User Interface   B     Sounds / Music   B     Replay-ability   C+     Overall    B-

This game is so amazing and very fun to play, especially with a partner (Story mode/The Mercenaries/The Mercenaries Reunion) or with a group (Versus) . Thanks CAPCOM for including the Gold Edition contents in the Steam version. I love this game so much.
I only played about 16 minutes because the Chainsaw Guy scared me...

RESIDENT RAMBO 5  Actually this should really have been called RE4 Part II or perhaps another REVLATIONS title, nevertheless I am giving this a thumbs up because I bought it in the Summer Sale for Six Dollars, if I had paid full price then maybe I would have differen't opinions about it.  As others have mentioned as far as gameplay and progression go this is almost a carbon copy of RE4, with a couple of really good (and sadly very short) 'Operation Wolf' Type levels thrown in at the half way point, suffice it to say this is a big budget 'Switch your Brain Off' shooter with the bizzare addition (experiment?) of an AI partner system for sol play which isn't too much of a problem for the First Half but then gets to be a BIG problem. More on that later...  Everything about this game is BIG, Cinematic and Bombastic and for the most part it looks really good even though there is a distinct lack of variety in the Scenery. With a few exceptions the graphics are all a mix of South African Shanty Towns with Mad Max that make up Roughly Two Thirds of the entire game. The cutscenes are done in that dramatic Shaky-Cam style, which was very trendy when this was released, and on the whole it holds up very well for it's age. Running on a NVIDIA GTX 870 this is smooth and flicker free although there are some serious bugs on the Tanker Level that make progression next to impossible depending on what loads and what does not.  So what of the actual Mechanics and playability? Sadly this is a complete Train Wreck that is WAY too complicated to use and slowly gets worse as the game progresses making it virtually impossible without the use of a controller. Even so when it comes to the Boss Fights and later the Maze and Corridor levels you will spend most of the time either looking at the keyboard or controler rather than enjoying the action on the screen. Making matters worse there are way to many intrusive Quick Time sections that invade the levels and the Boss Fightswithout warning which also change the keys each time causing the player to be looking perminently at the keyboard and missing the action. It is also in these stages that the really bad AI of the partner becomes apparent and it spends most of the time blocking you in corners and getting you killed. There really should have been an option to play without it and I am Amazed that this was not offered.  By this time CAPCOM had already gone too far away from what RE is meant to be and it is evident that they were listening to the 'Suits' rather than the fans. It is also evident that they were trying to be like the RE Films going so far as to transform Wesker from an interesting 'Bond Villian' with character into an evil superhero part NEO Part Darth Vader. The two versions of RE should have been allowed to exist as completely seperate entities.  What we have here is really a long version of MERCINARIES.  In conclusion I cannot really complain at Six Dollars, so it is for that reason I am giving it a thumbs up, but I would not have been so sympathetic if I had paid full price.   PS Trivia......did anyone else notice that the music between levels is a slowed down version of the Ocean Theme from Mario 64?
I died because my friend didn't react to a QTE.
Gets a bad rap for not being the same old RE formula, but it's alrght. Not a bad game, especially if you just play it like a Bro-Op shooter.
Chris before rehab.

This game i have bought for each of my game systems , It's addicting with a great story and it isn't overly easy ! No matter how many times i stop playing this game i always come back to it eventually to re- run through the game, I beat it on Ps4, ps3 xbox one and xbox 360 and i just got it on steam and am gonna begin another run through of the game from scratch!

It's more an action game than a horror one, but it's very good. I recently finished the game in CO-OP, and it was so funny. I recommend to play this game with a friend, it becomes way better because Sheva is not be the best AI.
It has Jill in it. 10/10

I see this game in two ways:   1) This game is racist!  Hundreds of angry black people are hunting two poor white people and it's obvious they want to kill them...  2) This game is racist! Two armed white people moving everywhere and they are just killing all black people they meet...   RECOMMENDED!
WOW! After 3+? years i can finally play this game. Thanks for letting me play this game my shekel loving masters XD =DDD game of the year xD bestest gAME Ever. THANK YOU BASEd CApcom

It's a fun little game, and much merriment can be had by replacing the skin for the various crows in the game with the skin for wesker, who has inexplicably become the matrix.  The game really picks up around act five where our glorious white hero takes the battle to a native village and blasts his way through wave after wave of semi naked screaming spear armed african 'natives' . You can do this while armed with a portable gatling gun.   They really should have just called this British Empire: the game.      Things I learned: Someone at capcom really, really thinks black people are a type of orc.

I bought this game just so I could have it in my Steam Library. This really is a great game, I keep coming back to it to beat it at least once a year for fun. Resident Evil 4 is of course better in my opinion. Anyway, grab a friend who hasnt played it and just beat it with him. It's a ton of fun.

In a world where the steroid man and best Ai take on the universe to fight aurobananas, the fiercest Albert of all the business men with standards. Using only their wits and that pen that they stole from that lady whos name sounds like a box company.
While the story and lack of actual horror make this less engaging than RE4, the coop is a really fun experience.

Take RE4 and add in co-op, and you're pretty much there. Cutscenes seem decent, but mostly my gameplay experience was 'not liking the PC controls, not having ammo, and getting a nausea-inducing headache,' the latter two traits I also remember from the previous game. It's probably good if it doesn't try to kill your particular head.
All the game itself its pretty cool and interesting!

Don't expect great single player, but the co-op and multiplayer modes are quite solid. It's not at all a true Resident Evil game, but more like an action/shooter/horror featuring Resident Evil's cast. Just bring a buddy with you on this one.

I might get some hate from this, but this is my favorite Resident Evil game. It's not scary, it's not like the old school games for ps1, and it happens mostly during the day. But this is still the best of the series. Get this game for:  Great Co op play Fun, over the top, RE storyline minus some of the scares Rediculous replayability with multiple difficulties and mercinaries mode Graphics that still look decent today Upgrades, upgrades, upgrades.  I've played this game for at least a hundred hours on 360, but it's still fun for me to play. If you want to play the same Resident Evil as 4 then GO PLAY 4. Does everyone really want Capcom to keep the series exactly the same? That would be pretty boring.

Wow I think I really hate this game yet I have beat it over 20 times and with multiple people. Sheva chucks spears for days. They ruined Albert Wesker. That isn't Jill. Game needs some more Barry. Chris loves Piers.    Console score: 7.5/10  Pc score: 8/10

Not has good has resident evil 4.  But still manages to be very enjoyable and there is a lot of replay value.   I highly recommend this chapter in the resident evil saga.   This is a great pc port  8.3/10  Update: No more Game For Windows live which is a good thing
i really liked this game, but it doesnt have the dlc for consoles D:
first chapters on that great but by the end it's a brilliant game.
Has great coop. though its a hard game, Recomemded if looking for something to play with a friend. you'll get use to the out dated feel to the game.
The AI will ♥♥♥♥ you off, but its basically an updated RE4, with some tweaks for it to stand out  Sheva/10
COMPLETE. GLOBAL. SATURATION.

With the power of steroids you can:  -Take tramatic and devastating abuse by hatchets and crafted blunt objects.  -Do front flips off 2 story buildings with no reprocussions.  -Take on hordes of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ of africans with aliens in their ♥♥♥♥.  -Punch boulders in your path and destroy them with your ♥♥♥♥ing fists.  -Knife barrels and destroy them in a millions pieces with 1 swing. No limits.  -Kick in metal and would be considered armored doors.  -All while spraying yourself with different strains of marijuana to stay alive.  10/10 would do steroids with a friend again.
THIS GAME IS NOT BROKEN it is infact a great game i highly reccomend.
Great past time for mowing down zombies with Chris's huge bisceps never seen in RE history!
Africa sucks

In this game you punch boulders in a volcano, fight hentai zombies, and watch as your black sidekick/friend take from you everything, and leave you nothing.      There's no dogs that help out in boss fights tho. Or an escort mission throughout most of the game.  7/10 Needs a couple of dogs and a blonde protag  there's no horror either...
It be fun to shoot not-zombies with a friend. c:

Best Resident Evil by far, Sure I don't have long played on PC, but I have played many hours on console, and beat the game multiple times. Great replayability for sure, always something you may have missed, and if there isn't you are just not looking. I wouldn't say its immersive, but its definitely satisifying gameplay/graphic wise.  I is probably on sale now, or will be during the SSS, so just check it out :D

Res5 is absolutly brilliant in coop. The game is almost perfect, great Story, strong and intense gameplay, high replayability, great survival horror atmosphere, great graphics and design, it´s just great 9/10
Good, but the controls can take some getting used to

If you ask any Resident Evil fan their opinion on the latest installment of their beloved franchise, they will likely tell you how far it has fallen from its roots. Some would consider the first Resident Evil game a pioneer of the survival horror genre. With scarce resources and a daunting atmosphere, the game made every encounter felt tense and nerve wracking. Resident Evil 5, released in 2009 and a good 13 years after the first game, took this formula and turned it upside down. Maybe the creators felt that the series needed to evolve. Perhaps they wanted to cater to a wider audience. Regardless of intent, this significant change was poorly received. But contrary to what the most hardcore “fans” have to say, Resident Evil 5 is far from a bad game.  The thing that struck me immediately as most impressive about Resident Evil 5 was its game engine, one internally developed by Capcom themselves. It is extremely optimized and capable of rendering impressive visuals at playable frame rates even on low-end systems. Unfortunately, Capcom never capitalizes on its engine’s abilities. Instead, players are treated with boring brown scenery after brown scenery. It would have been a pleasant surprise to see the engine render something other than foliage and sand so that the audience may witness its potential in full.  If you came into Resident Evil 5 expecting a thought-provoking plot driven by ethical dilemmas and life-changing lessons, you really should first reevaluate what you think narrative focused games are before looking elsewhere. Resident Evil 5 doesn’t aim to be a social commentary (and if it is, it probably does so unintentionally). It doesn’t aim to make its players question their morality. It just tells a simple story of two agents trying to stop the outbreak of a virus and honestly, that’s all it really needs, since the main driving force behind this game is its solid gameplay.  Resident Evil 5 can be played solo or with a friend. Prior to release, this was a very controversial inclusion as the community argued that co-op would diminish any sense of horror. While this argument is valid even today, having a partner to play with actually enhances the game’s enjoyment by allowing two players to share the experience of being overwhelmed by zombies. Even if you do prefer to play alone, the game forcefully pairs you with an unresponsive A.I. partner, so ultimately co-op is still the lesser of two evils.  The aforementioned major addition aside, Resident Evil 5 feels and plays very much like its predecessor bar the horror aspect. The controls are extremely responsive and every bullet fired or punch thrown has an “umph” to it. If you’ve never played the previous installments, you might be disappointed to find that the characters cannot shoot and move simultaneously. While unrealistic (and occasionally frustrating), this limitation does make a rather laid back game slightly more intense during fights against overwhelming odds. Staying true to its heritage, Resident Evil 5 also retains an inventory system that encourages players to be strategic with their supplies. With only nine available slots, players must give careful thought to how diverse of an arsenal, how much ammo, and how many herbs (essentially potions) he or she should carry.  Resident Evil 5 gets a lot of things right and had it not carried the burden of following its predecessors, I suspect it would have been wholeheartedly accepted by the gaming community. As long as you keep your expectations at bay, I can guarantee you that there is much fun to be had, especially when playing with a friend.  Grade: 4/5

This game was one of my first shooting games. I love the storyline, as well as the content in general. I found the controls easy to use, and it was overall an enjoyable experience. It was very fun but at the same time it was challenging, and that's what I feel makes a great game. I highly recommend playing. :)

So I played this game for countless hours on the PS3 when it was released, and it was probably one of the best games I have ever played. Is the PC version different from console version? Well there are only two things worth mentioning. Instead of the classic laser for aiming you are given a crosshair, this isn't really a big deal once you get used to it. Another thing is that the controls are a little clonky on the PC, but after about 2 hours of getting used to them, they won't bother you at all. Awesome game! It was great to relive all the cool moments this game had!

Amazing...  After all these years it still holds up, graphics and gameplay wise. Imo the co-op was nailed in this game.  Take the elevator scene, backs to the wall, horde of oncoming lickers and me and my buddy standing firm and holding our ground, shotgun and magnum in hand... epic. Thats what co-op brings to Resident Evil 5.  That is the stuff of dreams of any original RE gamer. Take yourself back to '96. You and your mates taking it in turns to play, we dreamed of two player, this game delivered that. Ok not the authentic or classic RE experience, but RE5 does what it does very well.

The best worst game you'll ever play, it's complete drivel but if you play with a mate, then it's comedic gold with pretty decent combat to boot that you lets you spend a few evenings twatting about doing awful Albert Wesker impressions. If it's on sale for £5 spend £10 and get a copy for a mate otherwise it's a waste of money.
Move a 10 ton boulder by punching it with your fists.

The moment I realised you can suplex zombies, break their necks and can become an overpowered god by the end of the experience makes this game one of my all time favourites. Lots of treasure to find, fun enemies to fight, simple puzzles to solve and loads of weapons to upgrade. Although the title doesn't share the same campy storyline of Resident Evil 4, it improves on every aspect of the combat and is a much higher quality port with solid keyboard & mouse support to boot. Very arcade-like and mercenaries mode is a blast. I recommend it whole-heartedly.

Highly reccomend it. Not only does the PC version have amazing graphics and framerates that blow the console versions out of the water, but it's still the same awesome game it always was and runs like a dream on the PC.  Price is a little steep for a game this old, though. I'd grab it when it's at least half-off for the Gold Edition (I personally got it in the Capcom Humble Bundle)

This game's one of the best kind of action games. It also has horrier scince in gaming with a lot of different zombies. There's some extra part of game that you play them through the gaming. It's during of: Versus - Mercenaries - Mercenaries reunion - Lost in nightmares and ... .  So if you wanna have good time and exciting playing I recommend you to try it. Thq. :)
Resident Evil 5 is the Best of all, Totally recommended !

This game is the first i guess which is not calculating with basic 'resident evil' standarts old games, but must say even through strange plot flow, fresh - fast reactions, was game fun and still kindy 'breathtaking' for first time...still playing around from time to time and still enjoying it...but from future expect more old habits, and less action and massive - global plots, which RE5 is only beginning of disaster ;)

The game is awesome and a decent port. The Graphics are nice and apealing and Chris and Sheva control pretty nicely. It may not be as good as the others but its still a good gem. They finally after so many years have added the DLC's. Thanks Capcom.

Not the best Resident Evil, but a hell of a lot better than 6 and very fun with friends. Made all the more appealing now that it is an actual steamworks game, the removal of GFWL may be a bit late, but coupled with the Gold Edition finally on PC and you've got the best version of RE5 bar none.
Best Resident Evil game to date with great story and gameplay.
i love this game
one of the best RE games ever

Beat it a couple times. It's more fun with friends once you beat it your first time. (I beat it on console) There aren't very many mods, and if there are, they are mainly nude mods, or it swaps sheva with jill or something along those lines. But it's a nice game I guess, better than RE6 I suppose :)

Im not sure what made me hate this game first time through. It has all the things I loved about Resident Evil 4 with the addition of co-op. The story is definitely Resident Evil-esque meaning its over the top and ridiculous but thats what makes it Resident Evil. Its not really a horror game at this stage but its still enjoyable. You have: -Gun Upgrading -Treasures to collect -Crazy Unlockable weapons -Replay Value -Mercenaries mode -Decent amount of costumes -The game is optimized well  If you find it for under $20 then I'd definitely pick it up.   (Just a tip: If you want to play in a resolution over 1920x1080 you should try a program called 'Flawless Widescreen' you can mess with your FOV and what not to make it more appealing and it also allows you to play in any resolution you desire)
